Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: A golden cinnamon harpsichord. A harpsichord is a stringed, keyboard instrument resembling a grand piano, only smaller in size. Unlike traditional keyboard instruments, this instrument has two keyboards, or manuals, with two or more strings for each note that produce sound by being plucked with a quill, or plectrum, instead of struck by small hammers. Four heavily carved legs support the somewhat heavy frame of the instrument.

A golden cinnamon harpsichord. A harpsichord is a stringed, keyboard instrument resembling a grand piano, only smaller in size. Unlike traditional keyboard instruments, this instrument has two keyboards, or manuals, with two or more strings for each note that produce sound by being plucked with a quill, or plectrum, instead of struck by small hammers.
Slender keys line the length of the keyboard. Each time one is stuck, the corresponding string within the body of the harpsichord is plucked producing a unique sound.
The strings on a harpsichord which are plucked by means of quills or plectrums.
The strings on a harpsichord which are plucked by means of quills or plectrums.
